preReadQuiz.description: Take this quiz to test your understanding of CSS layouts!

questions.description: Which of these is not affected by the box-sizing property?
questions.explanation: Margin is the space around or between elements. Regardless of how the elements width or height is calculated, the margin remains the same.

questions.description: When this box is rendered, what width will it be?
questions.explanation: Since the box-sizing was not specified, we can assume it's "content-box" and therefore the padding, border, and width are added together when computing the final size.

questions.description: True or False - static positioned elements are removed from the normal flow of the page
questions.explanation: Static positioned elements are always positioned according to the flow of the page. Absolute, fixed, and sticky positioned elements are removed from the normal flow.

questions.description: In the example below, what would be the total margin (gap) in between the header and the first item in the list?
questions.explanation: Margins collapse when they're applied to the first or last child. This rule does not apply if there is a non-zero top padding or border value on that parent.

questions.description: True or False - Buttons are block level elements
questions.explanation: Buttons are inline-level elements, like spans
